newsitem.title: INDIA: India 97/98 crude imports estimated at 33.6 mln T.
newsitem.headline: India 97/98 crude imports estimated at 33.6 mln T.

text.p: India's crude oil imports are likely to total about 33.6 million tonnes in 1997/98 (April-March) compared with an estimated 33.15 million tonnes in the previous year, petroleum ministry officials said on Wednesday.
They said gross domestic crude oil production in 1997/98 was expected to be around 31.2 million tonnes.

India produced 28.76 million tonnes of crude between April 1996 and February 1997, compared with 31.7 million tonnes in the same period a year earlier, the government said in a statement early this month. Output in 1995/96 totalled a record 35.35 million tonnes.
Ministry officials said India imports crude oil both through long term purchases on a government-to-government level and from the open market.

In 1996/97 India entered into term contracts for the purchase of about 18 million tonnes of crude. In 1997/98 it plans to buy about 26 million tonnes of oil through the term contract route, ministry officials said.
Purchases in 1997/98 were expected to be made from Saudi Arabia, Iraq, Kuwait, Iran, Malaysia, Nigeria and the United Arab Emirates, they said.
